page.title: 15A DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA.
page.content: On the lower slopes of the mountain above the Britannia Inn there are cows and sheep.On the upper slopes, above the tree line there are only sheep. The lower slops are divided into fields for animal grazing.The sheep on the upper slopes graze on grass which grows together with ferns and gorse bushes.The spring feeding the stream running down from behind the Britannia Inn has eaten away the land to make a steep valley.All along the stream there are many trees.Pine, Oak and sycamore.At the bottom of the valley there is a lot of wild garlic and at the top there are Bluebells and ferns.
